DataElement.preferredName: Positive Axillary Node Hematoxylin And Eosin Staining Assessment Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the number of positive axillary nodes by hematoxylin & eosin staining (H&E).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Positive Axillary Node Hematoxylin and Eosin Staining Method Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to positive axillary node hematoxylin & eosin staining (H&E) assessment. hematoxylin-and-eosin, or H&E, is a routine staining procedure of tissue sections that uses two separate dyes, one staining the nucleus and the other staining the cytoplasm and connective tissue; hematoxylin is a dark purplish dye that stains the chromatin (nuclear material) within the nucleus; and eosin is an orangish-pink to red dye that stains the cytoplasmic material including connective tissue and collagen.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Involving advantage or good.:Lymph nodes found in the armpit that drain the lymph channels from the breast.

Concepts.definition: One of approximately 20-30 lymph nodes in chain formation that traverse the concavity of the underarm to the clavicle.

Property.preferredName: Hematoxylin and Eosin Staining Method Physical Examination
Property.preferredDefinition: Hematoxylin-and-eosin, or H&E, is a routine staining procedure of tissue sections. This staining method uses two separate dyes, one staining the nucleus and the other staining the cytoplasm and connective tissue. Hematoxylin is a dark purplish dye that stains the chromatin (nuclear material) within the nucleus. Eosin is an orangish-pink to red dye that stains the cytoplasmic material including connective tissue and collagen.:A physical examination is a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment.

Concepts.definition: Hematoxylin-and-eosin, or H&E, is a routine staining procedure of tissue sections. This staining method uses two separate dyes, one staining the nucleus and the other staining the cytoplasm and connective tissue. Hematoxylin is a dark purplish dye that stains the chromatin (nuclear material) within the nucleus. Eosin is an orangish-pink to red dye that stains the cytoplasmic material including connective tissue and collagen.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The quantity of the specified item.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/11/17 tt transferred context, added reg status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task.
